<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__designing-fair-curves-using-monotone-curvature-pieces-16muf3x487">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__designing-fair-curves-using-monotone-curvature-pieces-16muf3x487">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__designing-fair-curves-using-monotone-curvature-pieces-16muf3x487" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>Sufficient Monotone Curvature Variation (MCV) conditions for planar Bezier and B-spline curves are described in this paper. Based on the MCV conditions which are presented, a shape control method for Bezier and B-spline curves is proposed. This method is described as finding a solution of an optimization problem subject to the MCV constraints. Since the shape control method for curves retains the desirable MCV pieces and eliminates all unwanted curvature waves, designers could easily modify curves to meet their design intentions. Practical curve examples for automobile body design verify the proposed method and demonstrate its applicable potentials.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-t4ikeq"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-h0fotu">01 Apr <a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-inherit MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-1b1tqk2" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14/2004" target="_blank">2004</a></span><span class="mx-1 my-auto break-all font-black ">-</span><a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-mh4g2t" data-element="journal_name" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14" target="_blank">Computer Aided Geometric Design</a></div>
<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__mesh-quality-improvement-and-other-properties-in-the-four-29fv4o260z" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>The so-called self-improvement property of the refinement algorithm based on the 4-triangles longest-edge partition is discussed and delimited by studying the number of dissimilar triangles arising from the 4T-LE partition of an initial triangle and its successors.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__mesh-quality-improvement-and-other-properties-in-the-four-29fv4o260z">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__mesh-quality-improvement-and-other-properties-in-the-four-29fv4o260z">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__mesh-quality-improvement-and-other-properties-in-the-four-29fv4o260z" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>The four-triangles longest-edge (4T-LE) partition of a triangle t is obtained by joining the midpoint of the longest edge of t to the opposite vertex and to the midpoints of the two remaining edges. The so-called self-improvement property of the refinement algorithm based on the 4-triangles longest-edge partition is discussed and delimited by studying the number of dissimilar triangles arising from the 4T-LE partition of an initial triangle and its successors. In addition, some geometrical properties such as the number of triangles in each similarity class per mesh level and new bounds on the maximum of the smallest angles and on the second largest angles are deduced.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__sleves-for-planar-spline-curves-4kha6qkghj" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>General criteria, that certify correctness of a global, polygonal enclosure built from a sequence of individual bounding boxes by extending and intersecting their edges, are developed that prove correctness of the sleve construction.</div>

<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__sleves-for-planar-spline-curves-4kha6qkghj">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__sleves-for-planar-spline-curves-4kha6qkghj">read less</label></div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__sleves-for-planar-spline-curves-4kha6qkghj" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>Given a planar spline curve and local tolerances, a matched pair of polygons is computed that encloses the curve and whose width (distance between corresponding break points) is below the tolerances. This is the simplest instance of a subdividable linear efficient variety enclosure, short sleve.We develop general criteria, that certify correctness of a global, polygonal enclosure built from a sequence of individual bounding boxes by extending and intersecting their edges. These criteria prove correctness of the sleve construction.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-t4ikeq"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-h0fotu">01 Sep <a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-inherit MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-1b1tqk2" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14/2004" target="_blank">2004</a></span><span class="mx-1 my-auto break-all font-black ">-</span><a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-mh4g2t" data-element="journal_name" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14" target="_blank">Computer Aided Geometric Design</a></div>
<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__automatic-construction-of-control-triangles-for-subdivided-4d5fhfi52e" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>An algorithm for calculating the B-spline representation of a Powell-Sabin spline surface on a refinement of the given triangulation on a √3 scheme, which is numerically stable and generally applicable.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__automatic-construction-of-control-triangles-for-subdivided-4d5fhfi52e">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__automatic-construction-of-control-triangles-for-subdivided-4d5fhfi52e">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__automatic-construction-of-control-triangles-for-subdivided-4d5fhfi52e" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>In this paper we present an algorithm for calculating the B-spline representation of a Powell-Sabin spline surface on a refinement of the given triangulation. The resulting subdivision scheme is a √3 scheme; a new vertex is added inside every original triangle. Applying the √3 scheme twice yields a triadic scheme, every original edge is split into three new edges, but special care is needed at the boundaries. The scheme is numerically stable and generally applicable, there are no restrictions on the initial triangulation.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__interpolation-with-cubic-spirals-2llmc681o3" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>Numerical techniques are used to study parametric Bezier cubics of monotonic curvature, and tools are presented for design applications. <div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__a-generative-classification-of-mesh-refinement-rules-with-1mul9ep2nf" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>This work expands recent results in the classification of primal triangular subdivision by finding new univariate and bivariate refinement rules with the lowest possible ratio of similarity, showing that this very low ratio usually comes at the expense of symmetry.</div>

<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__a-generative-classification-of-mesh-refinement-rules-with-1mul9ep2nf">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__a-generative-classification-of-mesh-refinement-rules-with-1mul9ep2nf">read less</label></div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__a-generative-classification-of-mesh-refinement-rules-with-1mul9ep2nf" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>We give a classification of subdivision refinement rules using similarity transformations of lattices. Our work expands recent results in the classification of primal triangular subdivision (Alexa, 2002). In the examples we concentrate on the cases with a low ratio of similarity and find new univariate and bivariate refinement rules with the lowest possible such ratio, showing that this very low ratio usually comes at the expense of symmetry.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-t4ikeq"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-h0fotu">01 Sep <a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-inherit MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-1b1tqk2" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14/2004" target="_blank">2004</a></span><span class="mx-1 my-auto break-all font-black ">-</span><a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-mh4g2t" data-element="journal_name" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14" target="_blank">Computer Aided Geometric Design</a></div>
<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__exploiting-curvatures-to-compute-the-medial-axis-for-domains-188g0n5v5v" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>Strong proofs of some basics facts about the medial axis transform of a planar region Ω with smooth boundary curve(s) are given and a predictor/corrector algorithm (as in the numerical analysis of ODE's) is developed.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__exploiting-curvatures-to-compute-the-medial-axis-for-domains-188g0n5v5v">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__exploiting-curvatures-to-compute-the-medial-axis-for-domains-188g0n5v5v">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__exploiting-curvatures-to-compute-the-medial-axis-for-domains-188g0n5v5v" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>In the paper, strong proofs of some basics facts about the medial axis transform of a planar region Ω with smooth boundary curve(s) are given. In particular the decomposition of Choi et al. (1997) is derived from the set of regular disks. Two special algorithms to compute the medial axis are presented. Due to the decomposition, they can be applied to each part of Ω separately. 
 
Emphasis is given to the local analysis of the boundary's curvatures. This leads to an interesting connection to the theory of Dupin cyclides. With this mean, a predictor/corrector algorithm (as in the numerical analysis of ODE's) is developed. The examples show that the predictor yields already an excellent approximation; so only a few refining steps of the corrector are necessary.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__constructing-fair-curves-and-surfaces-with-a-sobolev-546j7dj4fq" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>The method is described in general terms and results are presented which demonstrate its effectiveness for constructing minimum variation curves which interpolate specified control points, tangent vectors, and/or curvature vectors.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__constructing-fair-curves-and-surfaces-with-a-sobolev-546j7dj4fq">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__constructing-fair-curves-and-surfaces-with-a-sobolev-546j7dj4fq">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__constructing-fair-curves-and-surfaces-with-a-sobolev-546j7dj4fq" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>We have devised a new method for constructing discrete approximations to fair curves and surfaces by directly minimizing an arbitrarily selected fairness functional subject to geometric constraints. The nonlinear optimization problem is solved efficiently by a Sobolev gradient method. We first describe the method in general terms and then present results which demonstrate its effectiveness for constructing minimum variation curves which interpolate specified control points, tangent vectors, and/or curvature vectors.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiBox-root css-t4ikeq"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-h0fotu">01 Jul <a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-inherit MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-1b1tqk2" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14/2004" target="_blank">2004</a></span><span class="mx-1 my-auto break-all font-black ">-</span><a class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 MuiLink-root MuiLink-underlineHover css-mh4g2t" data-element="journal_name" href="https://typeset.io/journals/computer-aided-geometric-design-le7roi14" target="_blank">Computer Aided Geometric Design</a></div>
<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__the-conversion-matrix-between-uniform-b-spline-and-bezier-59ft4jb8cu" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>This work proposes a very simple and efficient procedure for computing in a recursive way the conversion matrices which provide the direct transformation between uniform B-spline and Bezier representations of arbitrary degrees.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__the-conversion-matrix-between-uniform-b-spline-and-bezier-59ft4jb8cu">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__the-conversion-matrix-between-uniform-b-spline-and-bezier-59ft4jb8cu">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__the-conversion-matrix-between-uniform-b-spline-and-bezier-59ft4jb8cu" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>In computer-aided design it is both convenient and practical to use the matrix form in representing parametric curves and surfaces. One of the reasons is that the matrix notation allows an easy conversion between different shape representations and provides a convenient implementation in either hardware or software with available matrix facilities.In this work we propose a very simple and efficient procedure for computing in a recursive way the conversion matrices which provide the direct transformation between uniform B-spline and Bezier representations of arbitrary degrees.</div>
</div>

<div class="MuiStack-root css-qjfyu5"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="tldr"><div class="MuiBox-root css-9scvoy" htmlcontentheight="50px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__interpolatory-rank-1-vector-subdivision-schemes-4cf1fly9z7" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">TL;DR: </span>The concepts of interpolating and data preserving vector subdivision schemes and how these concepts are related are discussed and two examples are presented.</div>
</div>
<label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-more hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" data-element="read_more_tldr" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__interpolatory-rank-1-vector-subdivision-schemes-4cf1fly9z7">...read more</label><label class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 read-less hover_pointer hover__primary css-11r1iy3" for="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__tldr__interpolatory-rank-1-vector-subdivision-schemes-4cf1fly9z7">read less</label></div>
</div>
<div class="MuiBox-root css-1xlzx9v"><div class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 css-8dlpw5" data-element="abstract"><div class="MuiBox-root css-2z804d" htmlcontentheight="125px"><input type="checkbox" class="collapse_toggle" id="collapsible_HTMLEllipsis__abstract__interpolatory-rank-1-vector-subdivision-schemes-4cf1fly9z7" hidden=""><div class="html-content"><div class="html-container" style="white-space:pre-line"><span class="MuiTypography-root MuiTypography-body1 label">Abstract: </span>The concept of stationary scalar subdivision being interpolatory does not always extend immediately to the vector valued case We introduce the concepts of interpolating and data preserving vector subdivision schemes and discuss how these concepts are related We also present two examples</div>
</div>
